item.title: Solaxy Confirms Launch Timeline – $54M Raised and Only 5 Days Left to Buy Below List Price
item.description:
Solaxy has confirmed its full launch calendar, letting presale buyers claim SOLX on June 23 ahead of the Layer-2 mainnet debut on July 7. The bridge linking Solana and Ethereum, a block explorer, staking unlocks, Neptoon DEX and Igniter launchpad have all been scheduled through late July.

The post Solaxy Confirms Launch Timeline – $54M Raised and Only 5 Days Left to Buy Below List Price appeared first on Cryptonews.

item.title: DOJ Seizes $225M – Largest Crypto Scam Bust Ever, 400+ Victims Targeted
item.description:
DOJ has seized $225.3 million in Tether’s USDT, its largest crypto forfeiture, after following blockchain trails that linked the funds—laundered via OKX—to an international ‘pig-butchering’ scam that has reportedly cost more than 400 victims and $9.3 billion in losses across 2024.

The post DOJ Seizes $225M – Largest Crypto Scam Bust Ever, 400+ Victims Targeted appeared first on Cryptonews.

item.title: Cynthia Lummis Urges Congress to Fast-Track GENIUS Act, Warns Crypto Leadership at Stake
item.description:
Cynthia Lummis has welcomed the Senate’s 68–30 approval of the GENIUS Act, calling it a first step toward making the United States a crypto capital. She has urged Congress to advance broader market structure rules that define commodities versus securities and clarify CFTC oversight.

The post Cynthia Lummis Urges Congress to Fast-Track GENIUS Act, Warns Crypto Leadership at Stake appeared first on Cryptonews.

item.title: AI Warns of Crypto Black Swan: Would Blockchains Survive Nuclear War?
item.description:
Black Swan projections from ChatGPT o3 have outlined two extremes: a tactical nuke that knocks regional exchanges offline and triggers a 15-30 % sell-off, and a full-scale strike whose EMPs may fracture the internet, forcing satellite relays while liquidation cascades erase $1 billion in positions.

item.title: New Linux Flaws Enable Full Root Access via PAM and Udisks Across Major Distributions
item.description:
Cybersecurity researchers have uncovered two local privilege escalation (LPE) flaws that could be exploited to gain root privileges on machines running major Linux distributions.
The vulnerabilities, discovered by Qualys, are listed below -

CVE-2025-6018 - LPE from unprivileged to allow_active in SUSE 15's Pluggable Authentication Modules (PAM)
CVE-2025-6019 - LPE from allow_active to root in

item.title: Hard-Coded 'b' Password in Sitecore XP Sparks Major RCE Risk in Enterprise Deployments
item.description:
Cybersecurity researchers have disclosed three security flaws in the popular Sitecore Experience Platform (XP) that could be chained to achieve pre-authenticated remote code execution.
Sitecore Experience Platform is an enterprise-oriented software that provides users with tools for content management, digital marketing, and analytics and reports.
